channel.title: Questions for rsps users
channel.description: (317) What pulls you into playing a private server? What makes you stay? What makes you donate?

item.title: Questions for rsps users
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

quote=“u loose, post:1, topic:508586”
What pulls you into playing a private server?
What makes you stay?
What makes you donate?[/quote]

  1. A home that is not Varrock, Edgeville, or Lumbridge. I’m so sick of seeing those places, especially Edgeville. There has to be unique content (which can even include reasonable custom items), and if I see screenshots of features commonly found in server bases just moved around, I won’t play. A skilling area or skilling being a big part is a must. There can be no easy commands like ::pure, ::master, etc… Also, donation advantages is an instant turn-off. New gameframes/animations/models/etc are a no-go.

  2. It seems reasonable to get to the top of the hiscores. I don’t want to play on a 300 person private server where it would take me a solid week to even come close to the #1 page. Relatively fast skilling would be best, and different ways to train stuff would be nice. The skilling has to be accurate for what it’s trying to do. There must be some sort of economy, and a ::yell command is really awesome when it’s done right and not limited by donations.

  3. Well I’ve never donated and most likely never, ever will, but I must personally know the owner(s) and like them. They must have also done something to make my experience playing the server better. I have only come across one server where I would’ve donated had I the ability to.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions for rsps users
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:3, topic:508586”]1. A proper advertisement with effort put into it. I.E; no picture of special attacks, no giant feature list full of things the source already had, no pictures of giant mobs spamming “join cockadoodledoodick” because you rewarded them for doing so, etc. Show off things your server has that others don’t.

  1. A decent community and decent staff. This means no little kid staff who say “i kno im only 13 but i can be real mature at times even doe it takes me 60 seconds to type a propor sentance”, they need to be kind and helpful, and not be chosen because they no-lifed helping people for a week. And by decent community, I mean a community that at least knows what the game is about beside pking.

  2. A good owner, no pay2win rewards, and realist prices. I’m willing to give 10 or 15 dollars to a server I know will be up a couple months for a new skilling zone, but I’m not gonna give 25 dollars for full torva, korasi, and claws.[/quote]

Thanks dude!
Just wanted to know really!

Read full topic

item.title: Questions for rsps users

item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

  1. A proper advertisement with effort put into it. I.E; no picture of special attacks, no giant feature list full of things the source already had, no pictures of giant mobs spamming “join cockadoodledoodick” because you rewarded them for doing so, etc. Show off things your server has that others don’t.

  2. A decent community and decent staff. This means no little kid staff who say “i kno im only 13 but i can be real mature at times even doe it takes me 60 seconds to type a propor sentance”, they need to be kind and helpful, and not be chosen because they no-lifed helping people for a week. And by decent community, I mean a community that at least knows what the game is about beside pking.

  3. A good owner, no pay2win rewards, and realist prices. I’m willing to give 10 or 15 dollars to a server I know will be up a couple months for a new skilling zone, but I’m not gonna give 25 dollars for full torva, korasi, and claws.
